result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Nathan R. Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: see attached Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement scanned into court record

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
If the Defendant completes completes drug court within 18 months the probationary period will be reduced to 18 months.

9/19/17 Length of Probation is amended.

miscConds.notes: Payment plan $50 per month beginning one month after release from custody

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
Def to enroll in, comply with all rules, and successfully complete the Ashland County Adult Drug Court . Defendant is to contact Ann Whiting  within the next 3 days.

The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.
  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are consumed. Defendant is permitted to go to supermarkets and gas/convenience  stores even if alcohol is on premises. 
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
NO CONTACT with known drug users/dealers except for drug court/treatment/etc.
NO CONTACT WITH CAMERON DAVIS
NO CONTACT WITH ROBERTO GALLEGOS
NO CONTACT WITH JENNIFER GORDON
NO CONTACT WITH KRISTIN RAMME
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

timeConds.notes:
150 DAY OF JAIL TIME IS STAYED PENDING SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF DRUG COURT. STAYED TIME MAY BE USED AS SANCTION FOR DRUG COURT.
Defendant Granted Credit for Time Served
Defendant may serve in Bayfield County provided Defendant gets consent and arrangment is at no cost to Ashland County. 
Contact the Ashland County Jail within 7 days to set up time to begin serving sentence.

9/19/17 JAIL TIME VACATED.

Defendant Nathan R. Thomas in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEJ presented to Ct.  Parties are in agreement of the DEJ.  Court just received an Amended Information.  Count 4, Count 11, Pleads N/C to each count.  Counts 5, 6, RI/Dismissed.  Other counts apply to another defendant.  DE signed PQ and read completely, understand it.  No threats, force.  No consump of alco/drugs.  Agree no double jeapardy as to counts 4 and 11.  Court rev complaint - plea know vol given, factual basis exists, accepts pleas and finds guilty - convicted of Count 11 -  961.41(3g)(am).  DEJ  under advisement.  Ct 11 - probat for 24 mo - method to reduce by 18 mo -  report to DOC within 24 hrs, serve 180 days jail 150 days of this time stayed pending succ complet of drug court program, stayed time used as sanction for drug court -  So has 30 days left to serve w/ 2 days credit time served, w/r may serve in BCJ provided gets consents, costs Ash Coun nothing;   within 7 days contact ACJ provide a DNA spec make arrang to start serving jail time, no later than Sunday Oct 9, 2016 at 09:00 a.m. - enroll in comply all rules and conditions of AC Drug Ct Program and success complete- see Ms. Whiting from program do that within next 3 business days; report for drug court this coming tuesday, 09-13-16 at 08:30 a.m.  AODA comply; maintain absol; not present at any location where alco or mind alter sub consumed; Permit him to go to supermarkets and gas/convenience stores even if alcohol on premises; random testing, no contact with any known drug dealer or users except for drug court, treatment etc.  No contact with Cameron Davis, Roberto Gallegos, Jennifer Gordon or Kristin Ramme; any other counseling, 10.00 fine, plus costs for a total of $577.55 and any contraband ordered forfeited.  DEJ approving as written.  Convicted of a felony, not permitted to possess a firearm, cannot vote. pp $50/mo starting one month from release from custody.
